author: nashatyrev
content:
Yep, we have pretty naive logic in the jvm-libp2p: if not seen we will respond with `IWANT`, so basically we may send `IWANT` to all our peers if receive `IHAVE` from them at about the same moment. This definitely needs to be addressed, thank you for raising this issue! 
Filed an issue: https://github.com/libp2p/jvm-libp2p/issues/402

author: parithosh
content:
Note, Today's testing call would be cancelled in favour of async updates. We'd return to the regular call next week. 

Async updates:
Pectra:
- Devnet-5 compatible kurtosis config has been posted here, some early bugs have already been fixed: https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/892088344438255616/1319229366886203434
- Hive instance has been setup for EEST tests: https://hive.pectra-devnet-5.ethpandaops.io/ (Please reach out with a EL branch if you want to be added to hive)
- Open PRs: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/9144 & https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/9129 (both have no updates since last week)

author: sauliusgrigaitis
content: CL clients have no benefit from Hive tests in any way (for this pectra testing)?

author: parithosh
content: There are some CL specific hive tests, but not the ones configured right now. The CLs mainly benefit by knowing the ELs they interact with are spec compliant. CL testing is mostly kurtosis + assertoor + spec tests right now.

author: sauliusgrigaitis
content: Makes sense, my question was should CL clients in any way try to integrate with Hive for pectra testing. The answer is no.

author: sauliusgrigaitis
content: <@199561711278227457> can you add Grandine devnet5 to the mix?
